content.description:
Figure 1. Incidence of protoporphyria in a particular family

Protoporphyria is a genetic disorder characterized by an extreme sensitivity to sunlight. One form of protoporphyria is caused by a mutation in the <math alttext="A L A S 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>L</mi><mi>A</mi><mi>S</mi><mn mathvariant="italic">2</mn></mrow></math> gene that results in the accumulation of protoporphyrin, an organic compound, in the blood, liver, and skin. The pedigree in Figure 1 shows the incidence of protoporphyria in a particular family.
content.question: Which of the following best describes the inheritance pattern illustrated in Figure 1 ?

choices.label: Protoporphyria has an autosomal recessive inheritance pattern.
Protoporphyria has an <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-linked dominant inheritance pattern.
Protoporphyria has an <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-linked recessive inheritance pattern.
Protoporphyria has a mitochondrial inheritance pattern.

content.answer: Protoporphyria has an <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-linked dominant inheritance pattern.
